column4: The Senior Director Wealth Manager serves as the trusted advisor to our high net worth clients and their families. In this role, the incumbent provides comprehensive guidance to our largest and most complex clients regarding investment, trust and estate, insurance, tax and banking needs. S/He works with clients to design and implement asset allocation strategies and financial plans that meet their unique circumstances, risk tolerance, goals and objectives. S/He develops thoughtful strategies that enhance client service delivery and manage risk. The incumbent will work cooperatively within a team environment to harness all of the firm s resources on behalf of the client. Additionally, the Sr. Director - Wealth Manager will collaborate on potential new business opportunities; and enhance and expand the firm s relationships with Centers of Influence within the community. In partnership with Wealth Directors, Wealth Manager Fiduciary Specialists and Private Bankers, he/she will be responsible for developing current and future fee business. Prior experience managing large and complex family relationships preferred. An advanced degree or professional certification preferred. The Wealth Manager I - Fiduciary Specialist serves as the trusted advisor to high net worth clients and their families, as well as charitable trusts and foundations. In this role, the Wealth Manager I - Fiduciary Specialist will have responsibility for administering, and may manage, client relationships primarily comprised of trust accounts. S/he will need to interpret and understand trust instruments and related legal documents governing each relationship working with internal and external resources as necessary. S/he will meet with co-trustees and beneficiaries to ensure BNY Mellon, N.A. is adhering to the highest fiduciary standards. S/he will work with co-trustees to establish investment objectives, exercise fiduciary discretion and communicate appropriately with beneficiaries. In this role, the incumbent will be expected to assess, identify and address risk related to BNY Mellon s role as a fiduciary. The Wealth Manager I-Fiduciary Specialist will provide support to their local Wealth Managers and Wealth Directors with existing client relationships; collaborate on potential new opportunities; and enhance and expand the firm s relationships with Centers of Influence within the community. In partnership with Wealth Directors, Wealth Managers, and Private Bankers he/she will be responsible for developing current and future fee business and driving BNY Mellon Trustee and Executor appointments.  Qualifications The incumbent will have an undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience with 4 plus years of experience in fiduciary administration, including fiduciary taxation, and have managed larger client relationships. The qualified candidate must be self motivated and possess very strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills, as well as excellent written and verbal communication skills as this position deals directly with key client prospects as well as executives from external referral networks. CTFA, CFP preferred. BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.  The Role: 
 The Senior Wealth Manager serves as the trusted advisor to our high net worth clients and their families. In this role, the incumbent provides comprehensive guidance to their clients regarding investment, trust and estate, insurance, tax and banking needs. Senior Wealth Advisors work with clients to design and implement asset allocation strategies and financial plans that meet their unique circumstances, risk tolerance, goals and objectives. S/He develops thoughtful strategies that enhance client service delivery and manage risk. The incumbent will work cooperatively within a team environment to harness all of the firm’s resources on behalf of the client. Additionally, the Senior Wealth Manager will collaborate on potential new business opportunities; and enhance and expand the firm’s relationships with Centers of Influence within the community. In partnership with Wealth Directors, Wealth Manager Fiduciary Specialists and Private Bankers, he/she will be responsible for developing current and future fee business.
